Text.Value: Mother -

EditorData.NodeContext: Protesting.

Text.Value: I suppose we'll have to make do.

EditorData.NodeContext: Grim and resigned.

Text.Value: The past can't be changed. Focus on your future before that too is set in stone.
Enough! I will knock both of your heads together unless you cut it out.

EditorData.NodeContext: Intervenes, looking for player to her son - in full no nonsense mode - she's had enough of this and she's putting a stop to it - right now.

Text.Value: You bastard.

EditorData.NodeContext: Leaning forward - preparing to punch the player. Almost snarling with anger.

Text.Value: Exactly. Bloody traitors - the lot of them.

EditorData.NodeContext: Player has agreed with you - you're vindicated in your anger.

Text.Value: We will, son. Don't worry about it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gruff but kind - you're trying to calm your son.

Text.Value: Not another word! Back to work - all of you! We've a battle to prepare for!

EditorData.NodeContext: a firm dismissal as you snap at both player and Ikaron. Gruff.

Text.Value: No! Our so-called kin fled the moment their tails were in danger!

EditorData.NodeContext: Angry and aghast - you would never do this to your kin. You can't believe they left you behind.

Text.Value: You're right. Lingering on this won't do much good.

EditorData.NodeContext: Player has agreed with you - you calm down - resigned in your anger.

Text.Value: Even that cursed wizard took off. Rolan's magic could have made all the difference, you know!

EditorData.NodeContext: Ibid.

Text.Value: Ikaron! We're in for a hell of a fight - focus on the matters at hand, not the ones you can't fix!

EditorData.NodeContext: You snap at your son - but gently. This is beyond your control and you have bigger problems.

Text.Value: Your kin's probably bleeding out on a goblin pike right now. What a waste.
Cut it out, Ikaron! All this grousing is useless.

EditorData.NodeContext: Snapping at Ikaron - he's been complaining non-stop and you intend to end it.

Text.Value: Finally! Now can we all get back to work? Idle chatter isn't going to defeat those goblins.

EditorData.NodeContext: Relieved your son has calmed down. All business-like as you try to get everyone back on track.

Text.Value: Cowards deserve a traitor's fate.
Which is their problem now, not ours.

EditorData.NodeContext: Snapping back at Ikaron - you need him to calm down.

Text.Value: Leave it, son.

EditorData.NodeContext: Stern - you know there is no point complaining. You want your son to focus on getting ready for the fight.

Text.Value: The fools - they'll never make it to Baldur's Gate on their own.

EditorData.NodeContext: Spitting with anger

Text.Value: Spoken like a true coward.

EditorData.NodeContext: Snapping at the player - you want to fight someone - you don't care who.

Text.Value: I can't believe they just left!

EditorData.NodeContext: Outraged - you're furious with your kin.

Text.Value: I know. Thank you - for not running like the others.

EditorData.NodeContext: Resigned but thanking the player - trying to be hopeful. You feel like an ass for losing your temper.

Text.Value: What's going on here?
Exactly! And look: we're not on our own, are we? Not anymore.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gesturing to the player - trying to reassure Ikaron - make him see all is not lost.

Text.Value: She's right. The coming battle won't be easy.
Clan is everything. Those tieflings gave up their honour.
Some of the others took off in the middle of the night. Left their own kin to fend for themselves.

EditorData.NodeContext: Resigned with a note of sadness - you wished they hadn't gone, but it's outside of your control.

Text.Value: Rage is fuel. Use it for the fight ahead, not to complain.
I'd be devastated if one of my own betrayed me.
Sad thing, if that's the state of 'kin' these days.
Running's a smart move. Especially for us.
Running's a smart move. Especially for a tiefling.
We might die because a bunch of traitors cared more about saving their hides then they did about us.

EditorData.NodeContext: Player has disagreed with you. You're angry and happy to pick a fight.

Synopsis: Okta and Ikaron are gathering food/supplies for the den's defense. Ikaron is upset after seeing several other tieflings run off in the middle of the night for Baldur's Gate.
